title: Sure, here's a reading list of 20 articles on LLM-driven instruction following, focusing on recent advancements and research up to 2023
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"Instruction Tuning with GPT-3"**
**"Zero-Shot Text Classification with Generative Language Models"** - Yin et al
**"Prompt Programming for Large Language Models: Beyond the Few-Shot Paradigm"**
**"Learning to Follow Instructions in Text-Based Games"**
**"Interactive Learning from Policy-Dependent Human Feedback"** - Christiano et al
**"Aligning Language Models to Follow Instructions"** - Stiennon et al
**"Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback"**
**"Language Models as Knowledge Bases?"** - Petroni et al
**"Evaluating Large Language Models Trained on Code"** - Chen et al
**"Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models"** - Kaplan et al
**"The Power of Scale for Parameter-Efficient Prompt Tuning"** - Lester et al
**"Few-Shot Learning with Prompting for Natural Language Understanding"**
**"Language Models as Zero-Shot Planners: Extracting Actionable Knowledge for Embodied Agents"**

author.literal: **"Prompting GPT-3 To Be Reliable"** - Perez et al.

title: **"Learning to Summarize with Human Feedback"** - Stiennon et al
**"Language Models as Knowledge Bases?"** - Petroni et al
**"The Case for a Single Model that can Follow Many Instructions"**
**"InstructGPT: Training Language Models to Follow Instructions with Human Feedback"**

These articles cover a range of topics from the foundational principles of large language models (LLMs) to specific techniques for instruction following, including few-shot learning, prompt engineering, and reinforcement learning from human feedback. This list should provide a comprehensive overview of the current state of research in LLM-driven instruction following
